name: Bioenergia ry - Bioenergy Association of Finland
goal:
The Bioenergy Association represents the interests of the bioenergy sector in Finland. The association has ca 250 member organisations.

It represents the entire bioenergy sector from land ownership to forest and energy companies, and technology and research in the field. The association aims to promote the preconditions of the production, use, competitiveness and economy of bioenergy and peat.

It fosters expertise and know-how in the sector and co-operation between its members, and improves the general operating preconditions of the industry

Our member companies produce a significant part of renewable energy in Finland.

The association supervises the interests of its members and represents them when dealing with the key decision-makers of the sector

Summary of main services
•Interest representation of the bioenergy sector in Finland and the EU
•Media relations and conveying messages from members to the media
•Informing members of the energy policy and legislation
•Industry reports
•Studies and research in the field
•Seminars in the field
•Meetings between decision-makers
•Bioenergia magazine
•Newsletter to stakeholders
•Newsletter to members
•News bulletin on the bioenergy sector
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Energy, Environment, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Transport
euInitiatives: Energy policies, renewable energy legislation, production of heat, electricity and cooling with bioenergy, biofuels, renewable transportation, biogas, peat products
